html: 1.20.19  1:52 am   1.19.19  12:21 pm   Hey, I'm a professional physicist, and just so you know, this is a trap. Science actually becomes more useless the more fundamental you get, so a TOE would actually be the ultimate useless thing. There are many many things (in fact, the overwhelming majority of things in this world) that a TOE would not actually explain because no one outside of string theorists actually do science from first principles (deriving everything from quantum mechanics, etc). People just try to come up with models that fit their data. Please ask me if you need me to elaborate on any of this.

1.12.19  5:45 pm   1.11.19  2:46 pm - Your answer sounds romantic but that's not the case.

      Most pop songs use the same I-V-vi-IV chord progression -

      there has to be something about this that is objectively more pleasing than other chord combinations to the human ear, else the same formula wouldn't work again and again as it does now to make hits. The number of combinations that achieve the same effect must be limited and there has to be a pattern to it. Isn't that what studying music is all about?
